text:
:tada: Exciting update :tada:

As of 10AM EST today, the Data Panel beta is official open to the public. Simply go to <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/whats-new/betas> and join the `[Public Beta] Data Panel with associated record data in workflows` beta.

For reference, here is the Documentation link for the new features and as always, reach out if you have questions: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/use-associated-record-data-in-workflows>
Such a powerful tool in workflows, amazing work <@UHVJJUWFN>, <@U01DSSS4Z6D> and the rest of the team

I”ve built out a workflow to format a date property, but the result value is incorrect. For example. instead of MM/DD/YYYY. I get this MM/DDD/YYYY - 04/115/2023, but the actual date is Apr 25, 2023. Screen shots attached of my workflow config. Any ideas on what I’m doing wrong here?

Hey there! It looks like the date format here needs to be tweaked a bit. If you toggle “custom mode”, you’ll be able to see the function along with sample output so you can test it.

If you hover over the function name, you’ll also be able to see some documentation and sample values for this function.

In this case, it looks like the format you’re looking for is `%m/%d/%Y`!

Here’s the relevant knowledge base article: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#datetimeformat>
Thanks <@U052C4YRTQF>. That fix the formatting! Cheers :wine_glass:
